text: Parliamentary elections were held in Laos on 24 April 1960.Dieter Nohlen, Florian Grotz & Christof Hartmann (2001) Elections in Asia: A data handbook, Volume II, p135 The result was a victory for the Committee for the Defence of the National Interests, which won 34 of the 59 seats.Nohlen et al., p137 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Votes !% !Seats !+/– |- |align=left|Committee for the Defence of the National Interests|| || ||34||New |- |align=left|Lao People's Rally|| || ||17||–16 |- |align=left|Lao Patriotic Front|| || ||0||–9 |- |align=left|Peace and Neutrality Party|| || ||0||–4 |- |align=left|Independents|| || ||8||+4 |- |align=left|Invalid/blank votes|| ||–||–||– |- |align=left|Total|| || ||59||-1 |- |colspan=5 align=left|Source: Nohlen et al. |} ==References== Category:1960 elections in Asia Category:Elections in Laos Category:1960 in Laos
title: 1960 Laotian parliamentary election
